EmailTemplate.subject: Payment Deadline Reminder: October 15th
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {!Contact.FirstName}!
Thank you for registering for the Live Different Build to the Dominican Republic in December 2016!
Welcome to the Live Different team. My name is Joy and I am an Administrator for our trips. We're looking forward to meeting you in person and having you along on this trip as we work together to make a difference!
This Live Different Build is not only going to be an incredible opportunity to make a tangible difference for people that need it most, but also to have your entire world view changed!
Please review the following information to help you prepare for your trip:
Your Deposit is Due in Two Weeks: - Your first $300 deposit needs to be made within 2 weeks of your registration to secure your spot on the trip. Please use your volunteer portal to make your payment.
Forms Attached to this Email: - Consent Forms - Child Protection Policy - Child Protection Policy Agreement - Letter to Donors - Packing List - Criminal Record Check
* All these forms can be downloaded and submitted through your Volunteer Portal online.
Booking your flights:
Airport: Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic - Airport Code: POP Arrival: December 27th, 2016 Departure: January 5th, 2017
Airport Shuttle: - Once you have booked your flights, please forward me your flight itinerary. - When you arrive at the Puerto Plata Airport, our staff will be at the gate wearing a Live Different t-shirt and holding a Live Different sign. You will then be taken to Sosua by the Sea Resort in Sosua (10 minutes away from the airport).
Accommodations: - While in the Dominican Republic, we stay at a small and clean resort called Sosua by the Sea. It is located 10 minutes away from the Puerto Plata Airport in a town called Sosua. - The rooms can fit up to 4 people in a room with 2-3 beds. There is a private pool and beach that is accessible for all volunteers. - There is a buffet-style dining hall that we are able to transform into an event hall for all of our evening activities. The hotel has security guards that monitor the resort at all times to ensure our safety. - Shower towels, beach towels, a safe with a key, and bedding are all provided by the resort.
Transportation: We hire bus drivers for transportation and they arrive every morning at the resort to take us to the communities we will be working in. The drivers are experienced drivers whom we have been working with since 2005. They have experience driving in Dominican Republic as well as the legal documents to drive these registered vehicles.
Communities We Work In: Since 2006, we have developed very strong relationships with the communities of Arroyo Seco and Nuevo Renacer and that we work in. The communities knows Live Different very well and we feel very safe at all times while working on our building sites.
Work Site Safety: We require all volunteers to bring closed toed shoes, a hat/bandana, waterbottle, sunglasses, sunscreen, and leather work gloves. This ensures that volunteers are as equipped for handling equipment on the job sites.
Vaccinations and Medications: We do not require that any of our volunteers receive any vaccinations or medications to go to any of the countries that we work in. But, we do suggest that every volunteer visit their family doctor or local medical clinic and decide on your own about taking any medications or vaccinations prior to the trip.
Contact during a trip between volunteers and Canada: - There is wifi available at the resort and a wifi code can be purchased at the front desk. - Due to the fact that we will be using internet in a developing country, it will be hard for volunteers to receive a well enough connection to skype with their family members, but they can indeed use Facebook and e-mail. - All of our staff have cell phones on them at all times. We will be emailing everyone all of the emergency contact information before the trip starts.
DR 2016 New Year's Trip Page: Visit this link to view your trip page. Here you can read your trip itinerary and find information on how to create a Canada Helps page. It will also be updated with project details once they become available. http://livedifferent.com/builds/dr-new-years-public-build-2016
Photos and Videos: Here are some photos and videos from our past Live Different Builds if you would like to use them for your fundraising needs: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/3wke2n7mm37rg7e/E0VsZOT3q8
Check out our Live Different Facebook Page!: There are photos, blogs and videos from our most recent trips, it's a great resource to help you prepare for your trip: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Live-Different/189864944417296.
Visit our FAQ Section: You can also visit our FAQ section on our website as it is a great resource. http://www.livedifferent.com/faqs
Thank you for taking the time to read the above information. If you have any questions at all, please don't hesitate to contact me. I'm always here to help!
Sincerely,
Joy Yu Program Administrator
